alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 6:18PM EDT until May 06 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, Casey and Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 618 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Liberty, Middleburg, Lanhamtown, Lawhorn Hill, Gilpin, Mount Salem, Beech Bottom, Cantown, New Salem and Walltown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
